data.scheme_name: Special Incentives Scheme for ESDM Sector 2020-25 - Stamp Duty and Registration Charges Reimbursement - Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provides One-time 100% reimbursement of Stamp Duty & Registration Charges paid in respect of lease deeds, lease-cum-sale and absolute sale deeds.
data.eligibility: Units engaged in electronics systems design and manufacturing are eligible under the scheme.
data.conditions:
The company or entity should be registered in Karnataka under the Karnataka Shops and Commercial Establishment Act, 1961.
  1. The units receiving incentive shall have to remain in commercial production for a period of at least 3 (three) years from the Date of Commencement of Commercial Production or 1 (one) year from the date of receipt of last incentive, whichever is later. 
  2. Units should fulfill the specified employment criteria based on capital expenditure in plant and machinery.
data.beneficiaries: Units engaged in electronics systems design and manufacturing are eligible under the scheme.
data.prerequisites:
The company or entity should be registered in Karnataka under the Karnataka Shops and Commercial Establishment Act, 1961. The Land reimbursement shall be applicable for land only in areas other than Bengaluru Urban and Bengaluru Rural districts. The units receiving incentive shall have to remain in commercial production for a period of at least 3 (three) years from the Date of Commencement of Commercial Production or 1 (one) year from the date of receipt of last incentive, whichever is later. Enterprises must fulfill the below criteria for availing incentives under the scheme- 15 jobs per Rs.1500 lakhs worth Capital Expenditure on Plant & Machinery and then 7 additional jobs for every additional Rs1000 lakhs worth Capital Expenditure on Plant & Machinery. 
  • 50 jobs per Rs.5000 lakhs worth Capital Expenditure on Plant & Machinery and then 35 additional jobs for every additional Rs.5000 lakhs worth Capital Expenditure on Plant & Machinery.
data.context: Government of Karnataka, through Karnataka Innovation and Technology Society (KITS), Department of Electronics, IT, BT and S&T, has announced the Special Incentives Scheme for ESDM Sector 2020 - 2025 (hereinafter called the “Scheme”) effective from 7th September 2020, offering various incentives & concessions to ESDM companies in the State.
data.objective: To boost electronics manufacturing in India by attracting investments, fostering innovation, creating jobs, and enhancing global competitiveness. It offers financial incentives to promote self-reliance, strengthen domestic supply chains, and support advanced technologies in sectors like mobile phones, IoT, and semiconductor design.
data.description:
Scheme provide a one-time 100% reimbursement of Stamp Duty & Registration Charges paid in respect of lease deeds, lease-cum-sale and absolute sale deeds executed between the Applicant and KIADB / other Government Agencies in Karnataka / any other party with respect to lease / purchase of land, industrial plots, sheds, industrial tenements and flatted factories for setting up of Unit.
Cap on land: Up to 50 acres in all districts of Karnataka 
Cap on subsidy: Up to 1000 lakhs in Bengaluru (Urban) and Bengaluru (Rural) districts
data.how_to_apply:
Applicant can apply with the required document in the below mentioned portal - 
itbtst.karnataka.gov.in.
data.funding_mechanism:
1. KITS shall disburse the funds upon completion of all pre- disbursal formalities by the Applicant. 
  2. The disbursement of incentive may be in the form of Direct Bank Transfer.
data.additional_info:
Expansion - A Project/ Unit in Karnataka that has existing capacity of the goods proposed to be manufactured and there is an increase in fixed capital investment on or after 7th September 2020, in additional manufacturing lines to enhance capacity of the proposed goods (as per SPECS). 
Existing - Company / Enterprise in Karnataka which have commenced commercial production before 7th September 2020.
Modernization - A Project / Unit in Karnataka that has existing capacity of the goods proposed to be manufactured and there is an increase in fixed capital investment on or after 7th September 2020, to enhance, optimize / revamp the existing capacity of the proposed goods (as per SPECS).
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Fillable form – Annexure 6. 
2. Copy of the ESCOM power sanction letter and service letter with R.R. No. and date.
3. Copy of first electricity bill.
4. Copies of the latest 3 months electricity bills with receipt.
5. Undertaking for Exemption from Electricity Duty (as per Annexure 6A). 
6. Service Certificate as per Annexure 6B.

data.beneficiary: Specific Industry - Private Limited Company, Public Company, Partnership, Limited Liability Partnership (LLP) - Karnataka - Medium and All Non MSMEs
